QubitVis documentation¶

class qubitvis.Qubit(state=[[1], [0]], H=[[0, 0], [0, 0]], steps=500, dt=0.1, sequence=<qubitvis.Sequence object>)¶

This is a class that represents a qubit.

Parameters

  • state (2x1 matrix, optional) – The initial state, defaults to [[1],[0]]

  • H (2x2 matrix, optional) – The Hamiltonian, defaults to [[0,0],[0,0]]

  • steps (int, optional) – The default number of time steps calculated, defaults to 500

  • dt (float, optional) – The time that elapses between time steps, defaults to 0.1

  • sequence (qubitvis.Sequence, optional) – A sequence of pulses that the qubit repeatedly executes, defaults to a qubitvis.Sequence with no pulses

animate(steps=None, dt=None)¶

Shows an animation of the qubit as a Bloch sphere. Note that if you are using a Jupyter Notebook, you must include %matplotlib notebook at the start of the notebook.

Parameters

  • steps (int, optional) – The number of time steps, defaults to the value set during the object’s initialization

  • dt (float, optional) – The time elapsed between each time step, defaults to the value set during the object’s initialization

hamiltonian(H=None)¶

Returns and/or sets the Hamiltonian.

Parameters

H (2x2 matrix, optional) – The Hamiltonian - Does not set the Hamiltonian if the value of this parameter is None, defaults to None

magnetic_field(B)¶

Sets the magnetic field acting on the qubit (and updates the Hamiltonian correspondingly).

Parameters

B (list) – Represents the magnetic field - The first element is the X component, the second is the y component, and the third is the z component

path(steps=None, dt=None)¶

Shows the qubit’s path and initial state on the Bloch sphere.

Parameters

  • steps (int, optional) – The number of time steps, defaults to the value set during the object’s initialization

  • dt (float, optional) – The time elapsed between each time step, defaults to the value set during the object’s initialization

sequence(sequence=None)¶

Returns and/or sets the sequence of pulses (gates).

Parameters

sequence (qubitvis.Sequence, optional) – The sequence of pulses (gates) - Does not set the sequence if the value of this parameter is None, defaults to None

set_state(state)¶

Sets the qubit’s initial state.

Parameters

state (2x1 matrix) – The new initial state

show(time=0)¶

Shows the qubit as a Bloch sphere.

Parameters

time (float, optional) – Shows the qubit state at the time given by this parameter

state(time=0)¶

Returns the qubit’s state.

Parameters

time (float, optional) – Returns the state at the time given by this parameter

class qubitvis.Sequence(pulses=[], time_interval=1)¶

This is a class that represents a pulse sequence.

Parameters

  • pulses (list, optional) – Represents the sequence of pulses - Can be a string consisting of X, Y, Z, and/or I (representing the X, Y, Z, and identity gates correspondingly), or an array of 2x2 matrices representing each gate, defaults to []

  • time_interval (int or float, optional) – The time that elapses between each pulse, defaults to 1

U(H=[[0, 0], [0, 0]])¶

Returns the unitary operator for one iteration of the entire sequence of pulses.

Parameters

H (2x2 matrix, optional) – The Hamiltonian for free evolution, defaults to [[0,0], [0,0]]

U_t(time, H=[[0, 0], [0, 0]])¶

Returns the unitary operator for the sequence of pulses at the given time.

Parameters

  • time (float) – Time (starting from the first pulse)

  • H (2x2 matrix, optional) – The Hamiltonian for free evolution, defaults to [[0,0], [0,0]]

add_pulse(pulse)¶

Appends a pulse (gate) to the sequence.

Parameters

pulse (str or 2x2 matrix) – A 2x2 matrix representing the gate, or one of the strings ‘X’, ‘Y’, ‘Z’, or ‘I’ (representing the X, Y, Z, and identity gates correspondingly)

get_pulses()¶

Returns the sequence of pulses (gates) as an array of qutip.Qobj.

set_pulses(pulses)¶

Sets the sequence of pulses (gates).

Parameters

pulses (list) – Represents the sequence of pulses - Can be a string consisting of X, Y, Z, and/or I (representing the X, Y, Z, and identity gates correspondingly), or an array of 2x2 matrices representing each gate

qubitvis.get_bloch(state)¶

Returns the Bloch sphere coordinates (theta, phi) of a quantum state.

Parameters

state (2x1 matrix) – The quantum state

qubitvis.spherical_to_cartesian(theta, phi)¶

Returns the cartesian coordinates (x, y, z) corresponding to the given spherical coordinates.

Parameters

  • theta (float) – The polar angle

  • phi (float) – The azimuthal angle

qubitvis.xy4(time_interval=1)¶

Returns a qubitvis.Sequence object with the pulses (gates) X, Y, X, Y.

Parameters

time_interval (int or float, optional) – The time that elapses between each pulse, defaults to 1
